Headlines: Kenya Court Upholds President’s Election Win
Snippets: Justices dismissed two petitions to overturn the victory last month by Uhuru Kenyatta, a decision that came after a weekend of unrest.

Headlines: As Kenyatta is Inaugurated, Kenyans Are Feeling Economic Pain
Snippets: Kenya’s protracted presidential election badly hit the economy, affecting people across the social spectrum.

Headlines: Kenya Holds 2nd Election in Nearly 3 Months
Snippets: The country went to the polls on Thursday, but scuffles broke out and the police fired tear gas at protesters in an area of Nairobi.

Headlines: In Kenya, Election Rerun Challenges a Young Democracy
Snippets: Many in the country are asking themselves how, after the national trauma of post-vote violence 10 years ago, they have ended up with a crisis yet again.

Headlines: Political Clashes in Kenya Leave Several Dead
Snippets: The opposition politician Raila Odinga returned from abroad, and his supporters fought with the police.

Headlines: One Cheer for Democracy in Kenya
Snippets: Kenya needs a transparent, credible and peaceful re-election. The world will be watching.

Headlines: Uhuru Kenyatta Is Declared Winner of Kenya’s Repeat Election
Snippets: Mr. Kenyatta also won a vote in August that was nullified by the Supreme Court, but the new balloting was met by confusion and mistrust.

Headlines: South Sudan Army Makes Push Against Rebels as Peace Talks Begin
Snippets: The army marched into the town of Lasu in the country’s southwest, capturing a rebel headquarters.

Headlines: Low Turnout in Kenya’s Do-Over Election Raises Concerns
Snippets: With so little participation, some fear that millions of Kenyans won’t accept the results.

Headlines: Kenya Elections Marred by Clashes, Tear Gas and a Boycott
Snippets: For the second time in nearly three months, Kenyans voted on Thursday. Protesters tried to block the balloting amid clashes with the police.
